author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: یا بیت ‌الله إن هتك المشركون ستر حرمتك لا تحزن قد زیّنك الله بطراز ذكره بین الأرض والسّمآء وإنّه لا یهتك أبدًا إنّك تكون منظر ربّك في كلّ الأحیان ویسمع ندآء من یزورك ویطوف حولك ویدعوه بك إنّه هو الغفور الرّحیم
translation: Grieve not, O House of God, if the veil of thy sanctity be rent asunder by the infidels. God hath, in the world of creation, adorned thee with the jewel of His remembrance. Such an ornament no man can, at any time, profane. Towards thee the eyes of thy Lord shall, under all conditions, remain directed. He, verily, will incline His ear to the prayer of every one that visiteth thee, who will circle around thee, and calleth upon Him in thy name. He, in truth, is the Forgiving, the All-Merciful.
